properties.areaDesc: Kent, MI; Muskegon, MI; Gratiot, MI; Montcalm, MI; Clinton, MI; Ionia, MI; Ottawa, MI
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 10 at 3:46PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
Significant rises on the rivers and streams in the Grand River
basin downstream of Lansing can be expected by early next week.
How quickly the rain between Grand Rapids and Lansing changes over
to freezing rain will determine exactly how high the rivers in
this area rise next week. A slower transition to freezing rain
will cause the rivers to crest higher, while a faster transition
will lower the crest. With many rivers expected to rise to near
flood stage, now is the time to prepare for significant water
level rises and potential flooding. The Looking Glass River near
Eagle, the Maple River at Maple Rapids, and the Grand River at
Comstock Park and Robinson Township are the most likely locations
that could see some minor flooding by early next week.

Stay tuned to the latest water and weather forecasts at
www.weather.gov/grr


AMD
